metadata.description: Transporter configuration including physics, task areas, and start positions

fields.model: Transporter model type (e.g., '2D' for two-dimensional movement)
fields.start_station: Station number where transporter begins operation

physics.x_acceleration_time_s: Time in seconds to reach maximum speed in X direction (horizontal along line)
physics.x_deceleration_time_s: Time in seconds to decelerate from maximum speed to stop in X direction
physics.x_max_speed_mm_s: Maximum X-axis travel speed in millimeters per second
physics.y_acceleration_time_s: Time in seconds to reach maximum speed in Y direction (horizontal perpendicular to line, 0 for 2D)
physics.y_deceleration_time_s: Time in seconds to decelerate from maximum speed to stop in Y direction (0 for 2D)
physics.y_max_speed_mm_s: Maximum Y-axis travel speed in millimeters per second (0 for 2D transporters)
physics.z_total_distance_mm: Total vertical (Z-axis) travel distance in millimeters
physics.z_slow_distance_dry_mm: Vertical distance requiring slow speed when dry (no load) in mm
physics.z_slow_distance_wet_mm: Vertical distance requiring slow speed when wet (with load) in mm
physics.z_slow_end_distance_mm: Final slow approach distance before stopping in mm
physics.z_slow_speed_mm_s: Slow vertical movement speed in mm/s
physics.z_fast_speed_mm_s: Fast vertical movement speed in mm/s
physics.avoid_distance_mm: Minimum allowed distance in X direction (horizontal along line) between this transporter and other transporters, in millimeters (0 = no restriction). This is used for collision avoidance when multiple transporters share the same X-axis track.

task_areas.description: Defines operational boundaries for each production line

line_xxx.min_lift_station: Lowest station number where transporter can lift loads
line_xxx.max_lift_station: Highest station number where transporter can lift loads
line_xxx.min_sink_station: Lowest station number where transporter can lower loads
line_xxx.max_sink_station: Highest station number where transporter can lower loads

notes: 2D transporters typically serve only one line (one line_xxx with non-zero values)
3D transporters can serve multiple lines (multiple line_xxx with non-zero values)
Station numbers with value 0 indicate the line is not operational or not assigned to this transporter
Station numbers with value 0 indicate the line is not operational or not assigned to this transporter
Task areas define operational zones - transporters cannot operate outside their assigned min/max ranges
Physics parameters are critical for accurate movement time calculations in simulation
2D transporters serve a single line, 3D transporters can serve multiple lines
